content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: MIDTC
      operator: non_empty
    - name: MISPEC
      operator: non_empty
    - name: MIORRES
      operator: is_not_unique_set
      value:
        - USUBJID
        - MISPEC
        - MIDTC
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.180
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when there is more than one record present for any particular
  Microscopic Finding in the MI Domain, for a subject on a particular date.
#The check for this rule was revised to NOT check the records where MIDTC is null
Outcome:
  Message: The Microscopic Finding test result is not unique for this subject and
    date/time.
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
    - MITESTCD
    - MIORRES
    - MISPEC
    - MIDTC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '180'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: One record per finding per specimen per subject
                Document: SENDIG v3.1
                Section: 6.3.7.1
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - FINDINGS
  Domains:
    Include:
      - MI

json.Description: Raise an error when there is more than one record present for any particular Microscopic Finding in the MI Domain, for a subject on a particular date.

Outcome.Message: The Microscopic Finding test result is not unique for this subject and date/time.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: One record per finding per specimen per subject
